The origin of Dungeon Days

Premise

An illustrated collection of poems telling the story of fantasy characters from a humorous, familiar perspective for kids aged 6 to 9. These stories let us peek behind the “curtain” and discover what these magic and scary creatures do when there are no heroes to fight or epic battles to win. Born in the mind of Ted when he had a boring job in local government; Dungeon Days is influenced by the legacy of family, fantasy stories, games like D&D and Roald Dahl’s Revolting Rhymes.

Inspiration

During COVID Ted hung poems in the woods in Bristol. This was an opportunity to share the stories with the world during a difficult time. This led to Ted being featured on BBC Bristol.

Genesis

Ted wrote the Dungeon Days stories during lockdown. Friend and illustrator Marcus was inspired to create images for each of them. Ted then approached designer Ollie about creating a book.
